title: stikxl
author: stikxl
content: Hi,2x MSI GeForce RTX 3060Ti VENTUS 3X OC LHR 8GB GDDR6nvidia driver: 520.56.06HiveOS: 0.6-219@221115miner: T-Rexhttp://y.yum.pl/1.jpghttp://y.yum.pl/2.jpgI installed drivers, configured T-Rex. But I'm still locked at 30%. What to do? plx help

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: At this point, that shouldn't happen anymore, because even the new Nvidia drivers already unlock the cards. Are you using the latest version of T-Rex?Have you tried other programs other than T-Rex to see if it has the same result?

comments.author: hymperion
comments.body: I with the nvidia 510.60.02 drivers had no lhr problems. try a downgrade

comments.author: P00P135
comments.body: just use the latest stable drivers for 3XXX I think you only need 520 drivers for 4XXX

comments.author: stikxl
comments.body: Quote from: joker_josue on November 22, 2022, 12:49:15 AMAt this point, that shouldn't happen anymore, because even the new Nvidia drivers already unlock the cards. Are you using the latest version of T-Rex?Have you tried other programs other than T-Rex to see if it has the same result?I also checked: gminer, nbminer. And he gets the same 30%. It starts with +60% and then drops to 30%.Now I have nvidia-driver: 510.60.02I was downgrading T-Rex but it dropped from 60MH to 40MH.T-Rex - log:Quote----------------------20221122 20:17:59 -----------------------Mining at eu.ethash.k1pool.com:5010 [141.95.3.13], diff: 5.00 GGPU #0: RTX 3060 Ti - 62.30 MH/s, [T:46C, P:171W, F:30%, E:364kH/W], 110/110 R:0% I:0%GPU #1: RTX 3060 Ti - 60.32 MH/s, [T:36C, P:168W, F:30%, E:361kH/W], 98/98 R:0% I:0%Hashrate: 122.62 MH/s, Shares/min: 1.541 (Avg. 1.537), Avg.P: 338W, Avg.E: 363kH/WMax diff share was found by GPU #0, diff: 426.80 GUptime: 2 hours 15 mins 42 secs | Algo: ethash | Driver: 510.60.02 | T-Rex 0.26.6(overclocking) When I changed Memory Clock to 2600MHz then I got: 62.31MH2600MHz - 62.31MHz2100MHz - 60.32MHzhttp://y.yum.pl/3.jpg

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: stikxl on November 22, 2022, 06:32:58 PMQuote from: joker_josue on November 22, 2022, 12:49:15 AMAt this point, that shouldn't happen anymore, because even the new Nvidia drivers already unlock the cards. Are you using the latest version of T-Rex?Have you tried other programs other than T-Rex to see if it has the same result?I also checked: gminer, nbminer. And he gets the same 30%. It starts with +60% and then drops to 30%.Now I have nvidia-driver: 510.60.02I was downgrading T-Rex but it dropped from 60MH to 40MH.T-Rex - log:Quote----------------------20221122 20:17:59 -----------------------Mining at eu.ethash.k1pool.com:5010 [141.95.3.13], diff: 5.00 GGPU #0: RTX 3060 Ti - 62.30 MH/s, [T:46C, P:171W, F:30%, E:364kH/W], 110/110 R:0% I:0%GPU #1: RTX 3060 Ti - 60.32 MH/s, [T:36C, P:168W, F:30%, E:361kH/W], 98/98 R:0% I:0%Hashrate: 122.62 MH/s, Shares/min: 1.541 (Avg. 1.537), Avg.P: 338W, Avg.E: 363kH/WMax diff share was found by GPU #0, diff: 426.80 GUptime: 2 hours 15 mins 42 secs | Algo: ethash | Driver: 510.60.02 | T-Rex 0.26.6(overclocking) When I changed Memory Clock to 2600MHz then I got: 62.31MH2600MHz - 62.31MHz2100MHz - 60.32MHzMost likely you are hurting the card.3060ti's do 55-62 at 115-125 wattsthey should never never never never be clocked to 168 or 171 wattsall my 3060ti's run under 130 watts most do 120 watts and 58-59mhdrop the cards to 130 watts with memory of 2050come back with numbers then.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: philipma1957 on November 22, 2022, 06:46:20 PMQuote from: stikxl on November 22, 2022, 06:32:58 PMQuote from: joker_josue on November 22, 2022, 12:49:15 AMAt this point, that shouldn't happen anymore, because even the new Nvidia drivers already unlock the cards. Are you using the latest version of T-Rex?Have you tried other programs other than T-Rex to see if it has the same result?I also checked: gminer, nbminer. And he gets the same 30%. It starts with +60% and then drops to 30%.Now I have nvidia-driver: 510.60.02I was downgrading T-Rex but it dropped from 60MH to 40MH.T-Rex - log:Quote----------------------20221122 20:17:59 -----------------------Mining at eu.ethash.k1pool.com:5010 [141.95.3.13], diff: 5.00 GGPU #0: RTX 3060 Ti - 62.30 MH/s, [T:46C, P:171W, F:30%, E:364kH/W], 110/110 R:0% I:0%GPU #1: RTX 3060 Ti - 60.32 MH/s, [T:36C, P:168W, F:30%, E:361kH/W], 98/98 R:0% I:0%Hashrate: 122.62 MH/s, Shares/min: 1.541 (Avg. 1.537), Avg.P: 338W, Avg.E: 363kH/WMax diff share was found by GPU #0, diff: 426.80 GUptime: 2 hours 15 mins 42 secs | Algo: ethash | Driver: 510.60.02 | T-Rex 0.26.6(overclocking) When I changed Memory Clock to 2600MHz then I got: 62.31MH2600MHz - 62.31MHz2100MHz - 60.32MHzMost likely you are hurting the card.3060ti's do 55-62 at 115-125 wattsthey should never never never never be clocked to 168 or 171 wattsall my 3060ti's run under 130 watts most do 120 watts and 58-59mhdrop the cards to 130 watts with memory of 2050come back with numbers then.I think he is just hurting them a bit and not a lot because usually LHR cards do consume more than non LHR cards even when they are fully unlocked by Nvidia drivers so that is most probably the case but the fact that he is showing 170 watt means he is a bit overclocking them just a bit more than he should so no problem on the cards,the normal power consumption of a LHR 3060 ti is about 150-155 watt for 61-62 Mhsh in Ethash algorithm so in this context I don't think he is hurting that much the cards he has,he is just 15-20 watt over the standard power consumption when tuned to perfection of these cards.

comments.author: joaogti36
comments.body: remove all extra argumentslet the miner go auto

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: Quote from: stikxl on November 22, 2022, 11:24:50 PMGPU #0: RTX 3060 Ti - 60.11 MH/s, [T:35C, P:138W, F:30%, E:489kH/W], 7/7 R:0% I:0%GPU #1: RTX 3060 Ti - 60.10 MH/s, [T:29C, P:141W, F:30%, E:481kH/W], 12/12 R:0% I:0%Hashrate: 120.60 MH/s, Shares/min: 1.555 (Avg. 1.578), Avg.P: 281W, Avg.E: 429kH/WAlgo: ethash | Driver: 510.60.02 | T-Rex 0.26.8 Extra config arguments:Quote"lhr-tune": "77.5,77.5""lhr-autotune-mode":"full""lhr-autotune-step-size":"0.1" "lhr-autotune-interval":"5"In my mining journal (which I haven't finished writing yet), I talk about my experience with the RTX 3060 Ti LHR card:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5336026.msg59296752#msg59296752Check the configuration I used, even before releasing the LHR. After unlocking the LHR I was able to have speeds in the region of 63MH/s:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5336026.msg60706787#msg60706787 (July 17, 2022 - THE GRAPHIC CARDS)I hope this information helps.

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: well you are doing 138+141 = 279 and 120 mhpretty good numbersway better than 171+168 = 339 andÂ  122mhthanks for reposting new numbers and following my lead.think of that as your baseline and try full auto in a dayor tweak a bit in a day.you saved 60 watts and dropped 2mh much better for life of card.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: The problem is already solved. Latest news about RTX 3060 Ti.NVIDIA now wants to sell RTX 3060 Ti cards only with GDDR6X memoryAccording to Chinese media outlets, NVIDIA intends to completely replace RTX 3060 Ti GDDR6 graphics cards with the upgraded GDDR6X variant. https://videocardz.com/newz/nvidia-geforce-rtx-3060-ti-with-gddr6x-memory-expected-to-completely-replace-the-gddr6-variant

comments.author: batsonxl
comments.body: My asus 3060ti ko does 60mhs with 120w. Just get trex and lock core at 1400mhs and mem at 1100mhs.no need for power limit lock core uses energy that needs for 1400mhs core.also you can give target temp in bat file.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: For this video card, coins on the Etchash algorithm give very little profit, perhaps you should take a closer look at the Kaspa (KAS) coin.For the RTX 3060 12 Gb LHR video card, the new lol miner reduced power consumption by 30%.https://t.me/koliamainer/8398
